content: Singaporean professor and ichthyologist **Heok Hui Tan** is a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) [ichthyologist](/wiki/Ichthyologist) at the [Lee Kong Chian Natural History Museum](/wiki/Lee_Kong_Chian_Natural_History_Museum) of the [National University of Singapore](/wiki/National_University_of_Singapore). Dr. Tan's main interest lies in the systematics of [Southeast Asian](/wiki/Southeast_Asia) [freshwater fishes](/wiki/Freshwater_fish), encompassing [taxonomy](/wiki/Taxonomy_(biology)), [ecology](/wiki/Ecology) and [biogeography](/wiki/Biogeography). His primary areas of research focus on neglected and de novo [habitats](/wiki/Habitats) such as [peat swamp forests](/wiki/Peat_swamp_forests), swamp forests, and [rapids](/wiki/Rapids). As of 2018, Tan has authored two species of [Osphronemidae](/wiki/Osphronemidae) ([Luciocephalus aura](/wiki/Luciocephalus) and [Betta pi](/wiki/Betta)). ## Publications (selection) - *The Borneo Suckers: Revision of the Torrent Loaches of Borneo (Balitoridae, Gastromyzon, Neogastromyzon)* (Natural History Publications (Borneo): 2006) [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 9838121053, 9789838121057 - [Britz, R.](/wiki/Ralf_Britz), [Kottelat.
